social studies to bring business, industry, or land under the control or ownership of the government: The program’s huge cost makes it unlikely that Congress will try to nationalize health care in the near future. nationalization noun [ U ] us/ˌnæʃ·ən·əl·əˈzeɪ·ʃən, -ɑɪˈzeɪ·ʃən/

if a government nationalizes an industry or a company, it takes control of it and becomes the owner: Mexico nationalized its oil industry in 1938 after decades of control by foreign oil companies. After 47 years as a nationalized industry, the government broke Britain's railway system into around 80 private companies. Compare
privatize
